resources.string: No internet connection! Cannot be translated!

Psychological Welfare Identification Experts are applications that can identify you in determining the psychological Welfare that you have. 

 By : 

 Reny Rosa E 1417051120 
 Department of Computer Science 2018 

 Contributor :

In this Menu you can identify the psychological welfare that is recommended for you based on the statement provided. When the user selects the \"identification\" menu, it will enter the statement identification menu. In this menu statements will appear from each item of psychological well-being.

The personal’s ability to accept various aspects of themselves, both positive and negative, including acceptance of past experiences. Acceptance of this ultimately fosters a positive attitude towards oneself. Have a positive attitude towards yourself; Positive attitudes are reflected in the acceptance of various aspects of the self, both aspects that are self-strength or aspects that become self-weakness, and accept (feel positive) all past experiences.

Self Knowledge 
 Self Awareness 
 Biographic : games timeline 
 Think the opposite

Have a positive attitude towards yourself, recognize and accept various aspects of themselves both good and bad quality, feel positive about past lives.
 
 Be aware of your strengths 
 Recognize your weaknesses 
 Take a lesson from past events

Feeling unsatisfied with yourself, disappointed with what has happened in the past, feel troubled by some self-quality, hope to be someone else. 
 Unsatisfied with their current condition 
 Feeling troubled by some self-quality 
 Feelings or hopes to be someone else 
 Feel disappointed with the past

The ability of individuals to establish warm and intimate relationships with others Have a positive relationship with others; Trust other people, have feelings of empathy and affection for others, intimate / deep friendships

Have friendliness, satisfaction and trust with others; feel concerned about the welfare / safety of others; have strong empathy, compassion and intimacy, understand the reciprocal concept of human relations 

 Trust other people (want to open up) 
 Care (empathy) for the welfare and safety of others 
 Understand the reciprocal concept of take and give

Having very few close relationships with others; find it difficult to be friendly, open and caring for others; feeling isolated and frustrated at interpersonal relationships; not willing to compromise to maintain important sustainability relationships with others. 
 It is difficult to be open to others 
 Feeling isolated or not considered in the social environment 
 Feeling depressed in establishing interpersonal relationships 
 Do not want to compromise (yield) to maintain important relationships with others

The personal’s ability to determine personal standards, and assess themselves based on these standards, without being intimidated by the judgment of others. Have personal standards to evaluate themselves, so as not to seek approval or assessment from others. These standards are also used to regulate (regulate) behavior, so that in generating behavior not based solely on culture and collective norms

Having self determination and independence; able to withstand social pressure to think and act in a certain way; regulating behavior from within; evaluate yourself based on personal standards. 
 Have self determination (confidence to achieve something independently) 
 Able to maintain confidence in a decision from social pressure / demands 
 Able to regulate behavior independently 
 Evaluate yourself based on established personal standards

Paying too much attention about expectations and evaluations from others; depend on judgment from others to make important decisions; submit to social pressure to think and act in a certain way. 
 Depends on the influence / judgment of others 
 Take decisions based on other people's standards 
 Behavior is influenced by environmental norms / demands

The personal’s ability to choose or create an environment that is in accordance with their mental conditions and can help the process of optimizing self potential. Mastering environmental conditions; able to choose and create the environment so that it is suitable for the condition, and able to take advantage and opportunities from the environment.

Have an awareness to master and have the competence to manage the environment; able to control the complexity of the arrangement of external activities; use the opportunities around it effectively; able to choose or create an atmosphere in accordance with personal needs and values. 
 Mastering / having the ability to regulate the environment 
 Able to manage the complexity of the activities they have 
 Able to choose or create an atmosphere in accordance with personal needs and values.

Difficult to manage everyday conditions; feel unable to change or improve the atmosphere around it; not aware of opportunities; Feel unable to regulate the outside world (control of external focus) 
 It is difficult to regulate everyday life 
 Difficult to change or improve conditions / atmosphere in the surrounding environment 
 Not aware of the opportunity 
 Feel unable to regulate the world outside of him

The personal’s ability to determine goals and make them guide in life. Have an understanding of the purpose and meaning of life and then make it a direction to continue to be productive in achieving life

Have goals in life and feel directed; feel that there is meaning to life today and the past; holding faith that provide a purpose in life 
 Have life goals 
 Understand the meaning of life in the past and present 
 Hold firm faith / principles in life

Feeling has no meaning in life; have very few goals or objectives; feel lost direction; not seeing the meaning of past life; don’t have faith or beliefs that give meaning to life. 
 feeling empty in life 
 Not seeing the meaning of life in the past 
 Do not have principles / beliefs that give meaning in life
Self Acceptance \nGoal Setting \nTime Management – priority scale

Personal ability to maintain motivation to continue develop potential and actualize themselves by always being open-minded in the face of challenges. Have the desire to continue to develop their own potential by being open to new experiences, challenges and tasks. Constantly evolving and self-improvement

Have a feeling to keep developing; see yourself as a person who grows and develops; open with new experiences; have feelings to realize their potential; see developments in self and behavior over time; there are changes in the way it applies that reflect self-knowledge and effectiveness 
 Have the desire to continue to develop themselves 
 Open-minded with new experiences 
 The desire to realize their own potential 
 Monitor self development from time to time 
 Constantly changing behavior based on self-understanding

Feeling stagnation in yourself; do not feel any development or expansion from time to time; feeling bored and uninteresting in life; feel unable to develop new attitudes and behaviors. 
 Feel nothing more needs to be developed in him 
 Feel there is no significant change in him from time to time 
 Feeling bored with life that is being lived on 
 Feel unable to develop new attitudes and behaviors

Intrinsic Motivation 
Self knowledge - Self actualization 
Risk Taking 
Self confidence 
Responsibility 
Open-Minded with new experiences
For more information can contact email : Ochaaangelica@gmail.com

The results obtained from this application can be treated as self-improvement stimulation. \n The outcome of this application is not an absolute assessment of the psychological well-being of an individual.
